results.title: Jazz greats: from Louis Armstrong to Duke Ellington (PC)
results.brief_description: SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: 386-25 computer or better with 4MB of RAM, MPC CD-ROM player, S-VGA graphics card (640x480x256 colours) with compatible monitor, MPC compliant sound card, mouse, Windows 3.1. Using text, sound bytes and images, this CD ROM traces the history of jazz from Louis Armstrong to Duke Ellington. Chapters can be read on screen and cover big band jazz, jazz piano in the 1930s and 1940s, the New Orleans scene and women in jazz. A video gallery includes performances by Louis Armstrong in his first European tour, Duke Ellington and His Band performing “Sophisticated lady”, Count Basie and “I Left my baby” for the CBS TV broadcast of ‘The Sound of Jazz’ and Billie Holiday singing “Fine and mellow” at the same broadcast. There are discussions with jazz critic and historian Dr. Herb Wong as well as with musicians Dave Brubeck, Tee Carson and Shorty Rogers. Also included are the following songs as sound bytes: Jelly Roll Morton, “Black bottom stomp”; Louis Armstrong, “West end blues”; Coleman Hawkins, “Body and soul”; Duke Ellington, “Take the A train”; Johnny Hodges, “Jeep’s blues”; Bennie Goodman and Charlie Christian, “Breakfast feud”; Gene Krupa and Roy Eldridge, “Rockin’ chair”; Count Basie, “One o’clock jump”; Count Basie and Lester Young, “Lester leaps in”; James P. Johnson, “Carolina shout”; Fats Waller, “Aint misbehavin’”; Art Tatum, “Tea for two”; Bessie Smith, “Down hearted blues”; “Billie Holiday, “He’s funny that way”. The disk also contains a bibliography.

results.title: Javelin Throw
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Coaching and Training for Track and Field Events”.
Gives coaching tips for javelin throwing from Olympic athletes and coaches, plus footage of javelin events from the Moscow Olympics.

results.title: Japanese doll
results.brief_description: Describes the historical development of doll-making in Japan with a rich and colorful display of dolls of various designs. Also introduces the unique techniques of doll-making by one of Japan’s contemporary master artists.

results.title: Japan: country of delight
results.brief_description: A trip in and around Tokyo, showing the tourist the life and beauty of Japan. Tokyo, with its ten million people, is like Western cities, but has much to offer which is truly Japanese. Yokohama, Nikko and other areas surrounding Tokyo are visited. Shows the life style, industries and arts and crafts as well as the countryside and coastline, ceremonies and festivals.

results.title: Japan's living craft
results.brief_description: Explores an extensive range of traditional Japanese folk art. Originally created to fulfill the needs of daily life, this work has survived the centuries to become an integral part of Modern Japanese culture. The artisans, considered living cultural treasures by the Japanese government, let their imaginations work in many media and styles. Each craft has its highly developed skill and each its own set of tools, often made by the artisan. Includes ceramics, iron casting, dyeing and weaving of delicate cloth, construction of paper dolls and the creation of lacquerware. Shows that the traditional loom, less efficient and more cumbersome than its mechanised counterpart, is incomparable when it comes to making material. An incredibly dextrous woman, nearly blinded by age, work nimbly and painstakingly at the loosening of long ramie fibres in order to make one long continuous thread. Also shows the cutting of patterns for the dyeing of fabrics; the powdered gold and silver creations of ‘makie’ lacquerware; the many and varied ideaas created for kimono fabrics.

results.title: Jamaica
results.brief_description: Jamaica is the largest and most lovely island in the British West Indies. A brief glimpse of the market at Kingston, sugar cane plantations, rivers and waterfalls which make the island a Caribbean paradise. Also shows fishing and rafting.

results.title: Jackpine journey
results.creator_credit: Earl Clark, Associated Screen Studios and Canadian Pacific Railway
results.brief_description: A CPR steam train speeds through northern forest intercut with the story of vacationists enjoying nature. Scenes of: men canoeing along Ontario waterways, installing campsites, and fishing; spectacular scenery, especially near rapids and falls; and all types of wildlife. Narrated by Peel Stevens.

results.title: Jabberwocky (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Walt Griba, Thomas Howe and Simon Fraser University
results.brief_description: Lewis Carrol’s famous nonsense poem has been adapted for the screen in this animated version with a delightful twist. Animated by Elizabeth Canefoot and narrated by Chris Hildred.
